tool.name: MIcroSAtellite Identification Tool
tool.description: Identification and localization of perfect microsatellites as well as compound microsatellites
tool.command: misa_wrapper.pl -i "$input" -o "$output" -d " #if int($threshold1) > 0 1-.$threshold1 #end if #if int($threshold2) > 0 2-.$threshold2 #end if #if int($threshold3) > 0 3-.$threshold3 #end if #if int($threshold4) > 0 4-.$threshold4 #end if #if int($threshold5) > 0 5-.$threshold5 #end if #if int($threshold6) > 0 6-.$threshold6 #end if #if int($threshold7) > 0 7-.$threshold7 #end if #if int($threshold8) > 0 8-.$threshold8 #end if #if int($threshold9) > 0 9-.$threshold9 #end if " -s $interruptions

param.name: threshold1
param.label: 1 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 1 base pair must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 1BP repeats.

param.name: threshold2
param.label: 2 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 2 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 2BP repeats.

param.name: threshold3
param.label: 3 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 3 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 3BP repeats.

param.name: threshold4
param.label: 4 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 4 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 4BP repeats.

param.name: threshold5
param.label: 5 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 5 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 5BP repeats.

param.name: threshold6
param.label: 6 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 6 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 6BP repeats.

param.name: threshold7
param.label: 7 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 7 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 7BP repeats.

param.name: threshold8
param.label: 8 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 8 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 8BP repeats.

param.name: threshold9
param.label: 9 Base Repeat Threshold
param.help: The minimum number that 9 base pairs must repeat to be considered a microsatellite. Set to 0 to ignore 9BP repeats.

param.name: interruptions
param.label: Compound Microsat. Interruption Length
param.help: The maximum number of bases between two microsatellites to be considered an interruption.

tool.help:
**Tool Information**
*MI*cro*SA*tellite Identification Tool v1.0 Release date: 14/12/01 (version 1.0)
**Author**
MISA software: Thomas Thiel URL: http://pgrc.ipk-gatersleben.de/misa/
MISA Galaxy Wrapper: Iyad Kandalaft iyad.kandalaft@agr.gc.ca Agriculture and Agri-foods Canada Ottawa, ON, Canada
**Description**
Identification and localization of perfect microsatellites as well as compound microsatellites.
**Citation**
Exploiting EST databases for the development and characterization of gene-derived SSR-markers in barley (Hordeum vulgare L.), T. Thiel, W. Michalek, R. Varshney and A. Graner, THEORETICAL AND APPLIED GENETICS Volume 106, Number 3, 411-422
**Inputs and Outputs**
- Input - Accepts a multi-fasta file - Parameters X Base Repeat Threshold: Defines the minimum number of times that X-consecutive bases must repeat to be included as a microsatellite Interruptions: Defines the maximum number of bases between two or more microsatellites to consider them as one compound microsatellite. - Output - Produces a tabular output that lists the microsatellite locations with respect to the input sequence names.
**Hint**
The MISA script concatenates the fasta sequence name and description together when producing its output. Hence, cross referencing the output from MISA and the original fasta file will fail. Please use the Strip Fasta Descriptions tool on your fasta file before providing it to MISA in order to ensure that MISA's output contains only the sequence names as opposed to concatenated sequence names and descriptions.
